intro: Fendlera linearis, commonly known as the linear fendlera, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its slender, linear leaves are a distinguishing feature, and it produces small white to greenish flowers in late spring. Fendlera linearis is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
